page_title: 10 Days Gilgit Baltistan Pakistan Adventure Tour Package

sections.content: Hunza Valley is one of the top tourist attraction points in Northern Areas Tour Packages. We offer Hunza Valley 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and 9-day trips to cover all main tourist places. The most historical place to visit in Hunza is the Baltit & Altit Fort with your local tour guide, founded in the 8th century. You can see the mountain diversity of Nagar Valley (Home of Rakaposhi – The Mother of Mist) right from Hunza Karimabad. Trip to Hunza Valley offers many attractions such as Eagles Nest Hunza, Attabad Lake, and Passu Cones. We offer custom Hunza Tour packages, which include comfortable stays at hotels in Hunza in Karimabad, Passu, and Attabad Lake. Visit the Khunjerab Pass (Pakistan-China Border) on a day tour in this package. We have much time to cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge and boating activities at Attabad Lake. Take photographs with the backdrop of Passu Peaks. Karimabad is the capital of Hunza Valley, surrounded by the mighty Karakoram mountains. You will spend the night in a nice hotel in Karimabad, wake up early to a spectacular sunrise over Rakaposhi, then explore the thousand-year-old Altit and Baltit forts and overnight at Eagle’s Nest.

content: Visit iconic attractions such as Attabad Lake, Karimabad, and local forts
Sightseeing of Rakaposhi & Nanga Parbat and Hoper Nagar Valley
Drive along the Indus River on Karakoram Highway – the 8th wonder of the world
Discover Naltar Lakes (Blue and Satrangi Lake) with a Jeep ride
Witness sunset & sunrise at Eagle Nest with views of Golden Peak and Ultar Sar
Local guided tour to ancient Baltit & Altit forts
Ziplining, paramotoring, and river rafting in Upper Hunza
Spend time at Karimabad Bazaar and taste organic local foods
Cross the Hussaini Suspension Bridge via zipline
Travel along the Karakoram Highway to Khunjerab Pass
Stopover at Nanga Parbat, the 3-mountain junction point
View the diversity of Passu Peaks, Passu Glacier, and Shispar Glacier

Day_1: Drive from Islamabad in early morning
Travel to Gilgit–Baltistan via Motorway & Hazara Expressway
Short photo stops at waterfalls and viewpoints
Overnight stay at hotel in Naran/Chilas
Day_2: Check out and depart for Skardu
Drive Skardu via Gilgit–Skardu Road along Indus River
Short refreshment stop at Astak Nalla
Visit Shangrila Lake and Upper Kachura Lake
Transfer to hotel in Skardu – overnight stay
Day_3: Jeep excursion to Deosai Plain (4 113 m) in 4×4 Prado
Short stay at Sheosar Lake for refreshments
Sightseeing at Kala Pani & Bara Pani Rivers
Day_4: Departure for Hunza via Karakoram Highway
Short stop at Rakaposhi View Point
Day_5: Explore Attabad Lake and water sports
Day_6: Visit Altit & Baltit forts with guided tour
Explore Karimabad Bazaar and local food
Day_7: Check-out and drive back to Naran/Chilas
Stops at Rakaposhi View Point and Babusar Top
Overnight stay at hotel in Naran/Chilas
Day_8: Drive Naran/Chilas → Lahore/Islamabad via Hazara Motorway
Stops at Kiwayi Waterfall, Balakot, and Batgram
Arrive by evening/night and end of services

content: Boating and Jet Ski at Attabad Lake
Blazing Sunrise at Eagle Nest Duikar
Local food taste of Glacier Breeze
Taste of Organic Fruits of Hunza

content.question: How to book the Hunza Pakistan tour?
content.answer: Pay a 40 % advance via bank transfer, EasyPaisa, or JazzCash. Foreigners can use Remittance, Western Union, or SWIFT.

content.question: What is special about Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Often called ‘Heaven on Earth,’ surrounded by peaks like Rakaposhi, Ultar Sar, Nanga Parbat, with rich culture and historic forts.

content.question: What are the hotel options in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Options include Hunza Elites, Hunza Bliss Hotel, Offto Resort, Famree Resort, Darbar Hotel, Roomy Dastan, Serena Hotel, Luxus Hunza.

content.question: What are the famous fruits of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apples, grapes, cherries, and apricots; apricot blossoms bloom in March–April and fruit is harvested in July.

content.question: What are the famous cakes of Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Apricot Cake at Glacier Breeze and Walnut Cake at Café De Hunza are local favorites.

content.question: What to buy from Hunza Valley?
content.answer: This information is not available in the provided text.

content.question: How to get a tourist visa to visit Hunza?
content.answer: Apply online via NADRA E-Visa or through Western Union/SWIFT; no NOC required for Gilgit-Baltistan.

content.question: What is Hunza water?
content.answer: Hunza water is naturally gray-blackish, rich in silica colloids, and prized for health benefits.

content.question: Is there any airport in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Flights land at Gilgit (1 hr from Islamabad), then a 3–4 hr drive to Hunza.

content.question: Which mobile networks work in Hunza?
content.answer: Telenor, Zong, and SCOM postpaid networks provide coverage.

content.question: When are the spring and autumn seasons in Hunza?
content.answer: Spring: mid-March to mid-April (blossoms); Autumn: mid-October to mid-November (fall foliage).

content.question: What are the best restaurants in Hunza Valley?
content.answer: Notable spots include Café De Hunza, Rainbow Restaurant, Pizza Pamir, and local eateries.

content.question: How many days are enough to visit Hunza?
content.answer: A 5–8 day trip lets you fully explore Hunza’s main attractions.

content.question: Is Hunza Valley safe for tourists?
content.answer: Hunza is very safe for local and international visitors thanks to friendly communities and stable conditions.

content.question: What are the terms & conditions?
content.answer: Check-in 12 pm/check-out 10 am; specified meals only; park fees, tips, and insurance excluded; ID required; rates vary on blackout dates; itinerary subject to change.

content: Accommodation in hotel as per the variant selected
Breakfast and dinner as mentioned in the variant
All toll tax, parking, fuel, and driver allowances
Comfortable and sanitized vehicle for sightseeing on all days
Lunch, tea, and mineral water during travel
Laundry, beverages, phone calls, and personal expenses
Extra expenses due to acts of nature or political reasons
Porter for personal luggage, medication, evacuation, and rescue
